intro: Zichya pannosa, commonly known as the desert hibiscus, is a flowering plant native to arid and semi-arid regions of Africa and the Middle East. It is characterized by its large, showy yellow or orange flowers that bloom in late summer. The plant has thick, fleshy leaves that help it conserve water in hot, dry environments. Its stems are often woody and can grow upright or sprawling. Zichya pannosa is adapted to survive in harsh conditions, making it a resilient species in its native habitat.
